description.narrative: Output 2.1: Social protection systems strengthened to improve the focus on the most vulnerable.

Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Social protection systems strengthened to improve the focus on the most vulnerable.

description.narrative: A major milestone has been reached in that the Government of Maldives, with UNICEF's support, finalized the first-ever Maldives Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) in 2019. The President's Office has already expressed intent to utilize the MPI in improving the future reform process of the national social protection system. Furthermore, UNICEF supported the National Social Protection Agency (NSPA) in evaluating two key Social Protection Schemes, namely the Foster Care and Single Parent schemes, resulting in key recommendations on how to increase effectiveness and efficiency for the most at-risk children in the Maldives. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/12/2019

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Information and reports on child-focused public expenditures (by sector and sub-sector) is available by governments; sectors are health, nutrition, child protection, social protection, WASH and education

target.value: 2020:% of budget allocated for children for by sectors

actual.value: 2016:The investment case study os ongoing and will inform child focused expenditures advocacy

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of mechanisms to increase inclusion of excluded children into social protection

actual.value: 2018:Monitoring activities implemented during the year confirm the functionality of the single registry which provide useful data for analysis.
